background of night photos taken while d: the majority of the photo is dark
little to no vegetation is visible
some objects or patterns might be faintly illuminated or completely lit by the dashboard lights of the driver's vehicle
usually multiple streaks or lines from headlights, taillights or reflective road markings on the road are seen
road: constructed for travel by road vehicles or other forms of transportation
usually marked by white or yellow lane dividers
made of materials such as asphalt, concrete, or gravel
can have features like lines, arrows, or words painted on the surface
is often linear and extends beyond the frame of the image
may be visible from a driver's perspective and running down the center
sidewalk: a smooth or textured surface, often made of concrete
a clear boundary separating it from the road
often lined with buildings, walls, or fences on one side and roads or parking areas on the other
may have lights, signs, or other features along the edge
building: building boundaries with roof, floor, beams, columns
roof can be flat or angular
wall: made of materials such as concrete, brick, wood, or stone
often has edges, corners, or joints where sections meet
sometimes has windows, doors, or other openings
edges may be covered with moldings or trim
may be painted, decorated, or have graffiti
often has a regular pattern of texture or color
fence: a horizontal or vertical row of posts or bars
can be wooden, metal, chain link, or other materials
uniform or repeating pattern of posts and horizontal rails
a boundary between two areas, often separating a yard, garden, or property from a road, sidewalk, or other area
posts or pillars that hold up the fence may be visible
fence height and style can vary, but may be recognizable due to regular repeating patterns, especially if the surrounding context is one of the mentioned background items (e.g. road, sidewalk)
pole: a long, vertical, and relatively thin structure
made of metal, wood, or other materials
sometimes with a street sign or traffic sign attached
possibly with lights, power lines, or cables
often directly implanted to the ground with base support
traffic light: vertical or horizontal mounting on a pole
three round or arrow-shaped lights, typically red, yellow, and green, in a vertical or horizontal arrangement
a silver or grey finish, or reflective material
possibly lights may be illuminated or changing colors
traffic sign: often illuminated or backlit for visibility
vegetation: varying shades of green, brown, or other earth tones
textures such as tree bark or leafy surfaces
varying sizes and densities of foliage
foliage can be sparse or dense
terrain: presence of rocks, hills, or mountains
patches of different textures and colors representing different land features
varying shading patterns due to changing elevations
lack of man-made structures in some areas
sky: possibly illuminated by city or street lights
gradient color transition, typically darker towards the top
rider: Sitting on a motorcycle, bicycle, or possibly a horse or other animal
Often wearing gloves, clothing, or other protective gear
In motion, as indicated by motion blur
Pedals, if visible (for a bicycle rider), or a motorcycle's structure
car: metal body, typically colored in various hues
headlights (which may be illuminated at night)
distinct shape with a hood and trunk
side mirrors and possibly other exterior features like a spoiler or roof rack
truck: cab or front section with windshield and doors
cargo bed or container in the back
tail lights and license plate at the rear
headlights and grille at the front
color, possibly white, black, grey, brown, or silver
bus: usually white, yellow, or bus company-specific colors
a distinct front end with a large windshield and headlights
a side door and possibly a rear door
possibly a destination sign or route number display
train: one or more engines at the front
varied colors, such as metals, red, blue, or yellow
a prominent shape with straight horizontal lines
motorcycle: a long seat typically supporting one or two riders
often matte or shiny metallic colors such as black, silver, gold, or red
bicycle: at least one gear or chain to drive the front or rear wheel
a seat or saddle for the rider
pedals connected to the chainring or crankset to propel the bicycle forward.
